column5: Controls bypass state of delay effect

column16: 0: ANLG (Analog); 1: WET (Modulated analog); 2: BBD (Bucket Brigade); 3: JET (Analog flanger); 4: DOC (The Doctor); 5: FTE (Faux Tape Echo); 6: ETH (Ethereal); 7: MOD (Digital flanger); 8: SPC (Space Echo); 9: TAPE (Multi head); 10: DIGI (Digital)

column5: Controls delay time via knob emulation

column15: Only affects JET and MOD Programs

column5: Selects tape head combination for TAPE program
column15: Binary head selection: bit 0 = head 4 (16th); bit 1 = head 3 (8th); bit 2 = head 2 (dotted 8th); bit 3 = head 1 (quarter)

column5: Selects delay mode for Ethereal program
column16: 0: Quarter; 1: Quarter + quarter triplet; 2: Quarter + dotted eighth overlay; 3: Quarter + dotted eighth

column5: Sets rhythmic subdivision for tap tempo
column16: 0: Quarter; 1: Dotted Eighth; 2: Eighth; 3: Sixteenth; 4: Half; 5: Whole; 6: Dotted Quarter; 7: Triplet Quarter; 8: Dotted Sixteenth; 9: Dotted Half; 10: Dotted Whole; 11: Triplet Sixteenth; 12: Triplet Eighth; 13: Triplet Half; 14: Triplet Whole

column5: Sets high byte of delay time in ms
column15: Used with Delay Time Low for precise ms control
column16: 0-15: High byte value (delay time in ms / 128)

column5: Sets low byte of delay time in ms
column15: Used with Delay Time High for precise ms control
